result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emmanuel Rodriguez-Rivera

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Emmanuel Rodriguez-Rivera appeared by video.  Attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas appeared by video for Emmanuel Rodriguez-Rivera.  Attorney John Rejowski for Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. Case in court for status conference. Defense requests projected plea and sentencing date. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Emmanuel Rodriguez-Rivera in court.  Attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas in court for Emmanuel Rodriguez-Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney John J Rejowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Fred Svensson. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Emmanuel Rodriguez-Rivera in court with Attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared  in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
Defendant's Authorization to Appear and Act.

Adjustment Number: 22A 079673,
Payable Number: 1026877,
Receipt Number: 22RP033353,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Emmanuel Rodriguez-Rivera in court.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Patrick Ryan. Case in court for bail hearing. Defendant advises of retaining counsel. Court advises that either way he needs to appear at next hearing. Court sets case over for prelim. Case adjourned in Prelim court.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Equone M B.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Emmanuel Rodriguez-Rivera in court with attorney Margo Elise Clark.  Defendant Emmanuel Rodriguez-Rivera in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Emmanuel Rodriguez-Rivera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
